ThingDef.label: ordinary bed
ThingDef.description: A cozy mattress and sheets on a frame made of organic metal for resting.\n\nSeems like the only way to understand it more is for someone to sleep on it.

li.AnomalyDesc:
A cozy mattress and sheets on a frame made of organic metal for resting. A colonist sleeping on this bed will rest abnormally quickly.

Providing study knowledge about anomaly when someone sleep on it.

Classified as Class-0 (Safe) anomaly.
li.label: #1/3 Ordinary bed study report
li.text:
Enhanced Cognitive Function Following Non-Standard Sleep

Subject: {PAWN_nameDef}

Abstract:
This report details observations of Subject {PAWN_nameDef} following a period of sleep on ordinary bed. This deviated from the typical sleep protocol within the facility. While Subject exhibited abnormally rapid sleep and atypical brain activity, no adverse effects were noted. Interestingly, upon awakening, {PAWN_nameDef} reported newfound knowledge directly related to ongoing anomalies research in the facility. This information appears unrelated to prior exposure within the facility, suggesting unconventional pathways to data acquisition. Current research protocols may not be optimally suited to study this phenomenon. Further investigation is warranted.

Observations:
{PAWN_nameDef} was permitted to utilize ordinary bed for sleep, deviating from the standard protocol.
Sleep duration was significantly shorter than the norm for Subject.
Brainwave patterns deviated from baseline readings during sleep.
No negative physical or behavioral changes were observed post-sleep.

Outcome:
Upon awakening, {PAWN_nameDef} reported novel information relevant to ongoing research on anomalies in the facility.
The reported information was not previously known to Subject and could not be attributed to standard briefings or exposure within the facility.

Discussion:
These findings suggest a potential correlation between non-standard sleep and enhanced cognitive function, specifically related to anomaly research. Conventional research methods may not be sufficient to explore this phenomenon.
Temporary anomalous bed has been classified as Class-0 (Safe) anomaly.

Recommendations:
Further experimentation is required to substantiate these observations. Additional tests with {PAWN_nameDef} and potentially other subjects are recommended to explore the potential of non-standard sleep and acquisition of research-relevant data.

li.AnomalyDesc:
A cozy mattress and sheets on a frame made of organic metal for resting. A colonist sleeping on this bed will rest abnormally quickly. Resting in the anomalous bed appears to be linked to fatigue of colonists who haven't used them.

Providing study knowledge about anomaly when someone sleep on it.

Classified as Class-0 (Safe) anomaly.
li.label: #2/3 Ordinary bed study report
li.text:
Potential Correlation with Fatigue of Colonists

Abstract:
This report details observations concerning the effects of ordinary bed introduced into a research facility housing colonists. Following its arrival, a significant portion of the colonists exhibited increased fatigue. Notably, the severity of fatigue appeared to correlate directly with the frequency of experiments conducted utilizing the ordinary bed. These findings suggest a potential link between the ordinary bed and colonists well-being. Given this observation, continued experimentation with the ordinary bed is recommended with caution. Further investigation into the bed's properties and its impact on colonists' physiology is warranted.

Observations:
Following the introduction of ordinary bed into the facility, a notable increase in fatigue was observed amongst several colonists.
The severity of fatigue appears to be directly proportional to the number of experiments conducted utilizing the ordinary bed.

Discussion:
These findings suggest a potential link between the ordinary bed and the colonists fatigue. The observed correlation between experiment frequency and fatigue intensity warrants further investigation.

Considerations:
The data aligns with previous observations regarding Subject's abnormal sleep on ordinary bed. Both instances deviate from the established rest protocols and suggest potential unforeseen consequences associated with standard sleep environments within the facility.

Recommendations:
Given the potential detrimental effects, continued experimentation with the ordinary bed should be undertaken with caution. Further analysis of the ordinary bed's properties and its impact on colonists physiology is recommended.

li.AnomalyDesc:
A cozy mattress and sheets on a frame made of organic metal for resting. A neural processor hidden within itself that utilizes the brain neurons of people in its vicinity, helping to increase information processing capacity within the sleeper. A colonist sleeping on this bed will rest abnormally quickly, while draining rest of other colonists in the facility and causing fatigue on them.

Providing study knowledge about anomalies research in the facility proportional to the amount of rest restored.

Classified as Class-0 (Safe) anomaly.
li.label: #3/3 Ordinary bed study report
li.text:
Theory Regarding Ordinary Bed and Enhanced Cognitive Function

Subject: {PAWN_nameDef}

Abstract:
This report presents a novel theory proposed by Subject {PAWN_nameDef} regarding ordinary bed introduced into a research facility. Subject suggests the bed interacts with the brain neurons of nearby colonists, facilitating enhanced information processing capacity within the sleeper and leading to faster sleep recovery. This theory is based on data obtained during an anomalous sleep event involving Subject and ordinary bed. As a result of this event, the anomaly associated with the bed has been classified as Safe. Report concludes by outlining two primary options for moving forward: termination of the experiment by destruction of the ordinary bed, or continued use under controlled conditions for potential gain of research information.

Hypothesis:
Following their non-standard sleep experience, {PAWN_nameDef} has proposed a theory concerning the ordinary bed. Subject suggest the bed utilizes the brain neurons of colonists in its vicinity. This interaction, according to {PAWN_nameDef}, facilitates increased information processing capacity within the sleeper.

Discussion:
{PAWN_nameDef}'s theory posits that by leveraging the colonists' collective neural network, the ordinary bed reduces the cognitive load on the sleeper's individual brain. This, in turn, would explain the observed rapid sleep recovery in Subject's case.
Based on information gleaned during this anomalous sleep event, {PAWN_nameDef} has successfully classified the anomaly associated with the ordinary bed as Class-0 (Safe) anomaly.

Considerations:
The potential validity of Subject's theory requires further investigation. Additionally, a critical decision must be made regarding the ordinary bed. Reclassification not required.

Recommendations:
Destruction: Given the potential for unforeseen consequences related to the standard bed's influence on colonists' neural activity, its destruction may be the most prudent course of action.
Controlled Use: Alternatively, if Subject's theory regarding information processing holds merit, continued use of the standard bed, under controlled and monitored conditions, could offer significant advantages in anomaly research. This approach, however, necessitates thorough risk assessment and the development of safety protocols to safeguard colonists' well-being.

ThingDef.label: ordinary hospital bed
ThingDef.description: A bed with a frame made of organic metal specially designed for use in hospitals. Adjustable for a patient and festooned with built-in equipment, it improves medical outcomes over normal beds. Medical clipboard lying on the bed with some text written on it.\n\nSeems like the only way to understand it more is for someone who require medical assistance to be put on it.

li.AnomalyDesc:
A bed with a frame made of organic metal specially designed for use in hospitals. Adjustable for a patient and festooned with built-in equipment, it improves medical outcomes over normal beds. Medical clipboard lying on the bed with some text written on it. An injured colonist lying on it will heal abnormaly fast.

Providing study knowledge about anomaly when someone who require medical assistance to be put on it.

Classified as Class-0 (Safe) anomaly.
li.label: #1/5 Ordinary hospital bed study report
li.text:
Anomalous Hospital Bed Demonstrates Rapid Regeneration

Subject: {PAWN_nameDef}

Abstract:
Anomalous healing properties were observed during initial testing of a recovered hospital bed. Upon Subject entry, a crimson fluid emerged from the bed frame, engulfing the Subject. Following absorption of the fluid back to frame, all prior injuries were healed at an accelerated rate. The bed generated a new data entry on an accompanying it medical clipboard. These findings suggest the potential of the bed as a valuable medical resource. Further experimentation is required to understand the phenomenon and solidify these initial observations.

Observations:
Nothing written on medical clipboard.
Subject requires some medical assistance.
{PAWN_nameDef} instructed to lie down on a hospital bed.
After short time a crimson fluid emerged from the bed frame, engulfing the Subject entirely.
Subject's stress levels exhibited a minor increase.
Following another brief interval, the fluid was entirely absorbed back into the bed frame, uncovering Subject.
{PAWN_nameDef} was able to stand up from the bed by themself.
Some text appeared on on the previously blank medical clipboard.

Outcome:
All prior injuries sustained by the Subject healed at an anomalous rate.
{PAWN_nameDef} was happy regarding the swift and painless recovery process.
Textual data subsequently appeared on medical clipboard as one new row on it with information about {PAWN_nameDef}, it injuries that was healed and some score next to it.
Some study knowledge was produced during this experiment.

Discussion:
This positive result showed that this hospital bed have potential as a valuable medical resource for this facility.
Conventional research methods may not be sufficient to explore this phenomenon.
Temporary anomalous hospital bed has been classified as Class-0 (Safe) anomaly.

Recommendations:
Further experimentation utilizing subjects with varying degrees of injury is necessary to solidify these findings.

li.AnomalyDesc:
A bed with a frame made of organic metal specially designed for use in hospitals. Adjustable for a patient and festooned with built-in equipment, it improves medical outcomes over normal beds. Medical clipboard lying on the bed with some text written on it. An injured colonist lying on it will heal abnormaly fast, but in some cases will get more injuries.

Providing study knowledge about anomaly when someone who require medical assistance to be put on it.

Classified as Class-1 (Caution) anomaly.
li.label: #2/5 Ordinary hospital bed study report
li.text:
Unexpected Shift in Anomalous Healing Properties

Subject: [REDACTED]

Abstract:
Initial success with an anomalous hospital bed showcasing rapid healing turned problematic in a follow-up experiment. Subject immersion in the crimson fluid, previously observed to heal injuries, resulted in no positive change and instead inflicted new minor wounds. The bed's accompanying medical clipboard displayed altered data. While further knowledge was gained regarding the anomaly, this unexpected outcome necessitates a reevaluation of its functionality and a heightened safety protocol. The anomalous hospital bed has been reclassified as a Class-1 (Caution) anomaly due to its potential to inflict harm. Further experimentation is crucial to understand the cause of this shift in behavior.

Observations:
One row was filled with small score on a medical clipboard.
Subject requires some medical assistance.
[REDACTED] instructed to lie down on a hospital bed.
After short time a crimson fluid emerged from the bed frame, engulfing the Subject entirely.
Subject's stress levels increased.
Following another brief interval, the fluid was entirely absorbed back into the bed frame, uncovering Subject.
[REDACTED] displayed signs of panic and examined its body.
Text changed on a medical clipboard.

Outcome:
All previously documented injuries of the Subject remained unhealed.
[REDACTED] manifested new superficial cuts and minor injuries on its body.
Row with a score dissapeared on a medical clipboard. No additional row about [REDACTED] wasn't added.
Study knowledge was produced during this experiment surpassing that of the previous experiment.

Discussion:
The unexpected results of this experiment necessitate reevaluation of our understanding of this anomaly.
Reclassified anomalous hospital bed as Class-1 (Caution) anomaly.

Considerations:
It is crucial to note that the anomaly, unlike previously observed behavior, now demonstrates the potential to inflict harm. This poses a significant threat to the safety of colonists.

Recommendations:
Given the potential detrimental effects, continued experimentation with the hospital bed should be undertaken with caution.
Further experimentation with injured subjects is required to determine the cause of such change of behaviour.

li.AnomalyDesc:
A bed with a frame made of organic metal specially designed for use in hospitals. Adjustable for a patient and festooned with built-in equipment, it improves medical outcomes over normal beds. Medical clipboard lying on the bed with some text written on it. An injured colonist lying on it will heal abnormaly fast, but in some cases will get more injuries or can lead to colonist death.

Providing study knowledge about anomaly when someone who require medical assistance to be put on it.

Classified as Class-2 (Warning) anomaly.
li.label: #3/5 Ordinary hospital bed study report
li.text:
Anomalous Bed Reveals Lethal Potential

Subject: [REDACTED]

Abstract:
A seemingly healthy [REDACTED] subjected to an anomalous hospital bed resulted in a catastrophic outcome. The hospital bed, previously exhibiting regenerative properties, inflicted significant injuries and tissue loss on the Subject, leading to its demise. The accompanying medical clipboard displayed a decrease in previously high scores, suggesting a potential correlation with the subject's outcome. Experiment highlighted the unpredictable and potentially lethal nature of the anomaly. The hospital bed has been reclassified as a Class-2 (Warning) anomaly. Further experimentation, prioritizing subject safety, is crucial to understand the factors influencing this erratic behavior. Notably, this trial demonstrates the potential use of healthy subjects in future research.

Observations:
Few rows was filled with big score on a medical clipboard.
Subject didn't required medical assistance.
[REDACTED] instructed to lie down on a hospital bed.
After short time a crimson fluid emerged from the bed frame, engulfing the Subject entirely.
Subject's stress levels escalated rapidly, culminating in audible screams.
After screams stopped, the fluid was entirely absorbed back into the bed frame, uncovering Subject, or rather, what remained.
Textual data on the medical clipboard changed.

Outcome:
[REDACTED] manifested significant new injuries and substantial tissue loss.
Subject [REDACTED] expired due to extensive injuries.
Several high-scoring entries on the medical clipboard disappeared. Remaining entries displayed a decrease in score. No new entry for Subject [REDACTED] was generated.
Study knowledge was produced during this experiment surpassing that of the first experiment.

Discussion:
The outcome of this experiment has left researchers profoundly disturbed.
This experiment also shows that use of healthy subjects is possible.
Reclassified anomalous hospital bed as Class-2 (Warning) anomaly, due to its demonstrated lethality.

Recommendations:
Further experimentation with injured subjects is imperative to establish the factors influencing such erratic behavior.

li.AnomalyDesc:
A bed with a frame made of organic metal specially designed for use in hospitals. Adjustable for a patient and festooned with built-in equipment, it improves medical outcomes over normal beds. Medical clipboard lying on the bed with text written on it related to chance of healing/injuring colonist. An injured colonist lying on it will heal abnormaly fast or will get more injuries, which can lead to it death.

Providing study knowledge about anomaly when someone who require medical assistance to be put on it.

Classified as Class-2 (Warning) anomaly.
li.label: #4/5 Ordinary hospital bed study report
li.text:
Anomalous Medical Bed and Clipboard Reveal Interconnected Nature

Abstract:
The anomalous hospital bed exhibits a peculiar connection to its accompanying medical clipboard. Attempts to remove the clipboard resulted in its transformation into a liquid and subsequent reintegration with the bed frame. A new clipboard then materialized, replicating the previous one's data. Analysis of past observations suggests the clipboard acts as a log of interactions with the medical bed. New entries appear upon successful healing (accompanied by a score), while filled rows seem to increase the risk of subject injury, with the severity potentially linked to the total score. This revelation emphasizes the importance of scrutinizing the clipboard's information before using the anomalous hospital bed to enhance safety and potentially unlock the key to understanding of its operation.

Observations:
An attempt was made to remove the medical clipboard from the bed.
Upon moving the clipboard more than one meter away from the bed, it transformed into a liquid state and flowed back onto the hospital bed frame.
Moments later, a new medical clipboard solidified on top of the bed.

Outcome:
Removal of the medical clipboard was unsuccessful.
The newly formed clipboard displayed a copy of the previous clipboard's data.

Discussion:
Considering all previous changes in text on a medical clipboard it should be safe to assume that it provides information related to operation that will happen with subject on a medical bed.
When a subject is successfully healed, a new row appears on the clipboard with a corresponding score. This score likely reflects the amount of regeneration that occurred.
Conversely, when rows on the clipboard are not empty, there is a possibility of the subject sustaining injuries. The severity of these injuries seems to correlate with the sum of the scores on the clipboard.

Considerations:
An observer has identified a potential pattern: the likelihood of a subject experiencing injury from the hospital bed appears to be directly related to the percentage of filled rows on the medical clipboard.

Recommendations:
It is imperative to pay close attention to the information displayed on the medical clipboard before utilizing the medical bed on a subject. This information may hold the key to safely operating the anomaly.

li.AnomalyDesc:
A bed with a frame made of organic metal specially designed for use in hospitals. Have installed crimson liquid tank inside for rapid regeneration inside it fram. Medical clipboard lying on the bed with text written on it related to chance of healing/consuming colonist. An injured colonist lying on it will be healed abnormaly fast or will get consumed for liquid production by dealing more injuries, which can lead to it death.

Providing study knowledge about anomaly when someone who require medical assistance to be put on it.

Classified as Class-2 (Warning) anomaly.
li.label: #5/5 Ordinary hospital bed study report
li.text:
Theory Regarding Anomalous Medical Bed

Abstract:
This report presents a novel theory proposed by one of observers of anomalous medical bed regarding it functionality. Anomaly was labeled as Emergency Cellular Restoration Unit (ECRU). It suggested that ECRU function by utilizing a regenerative crimson liquid stored within its frame. Analysis suggests this liquid repairs human tissue, but requires refilling. The accompanying clipboard may track depletion and indicate refill urgency. A disturbing theory proposes the ECRU consumes tissues of some subject's for refilling, potentially fatally. Research aims to replicate the liquid for safer medical use. The report recommends either destroying the ECRU or implementing strict protocols for controlled use.

Hypothesis:
An observer, drawing upon observations from all experiments and information gleaned from surviving subjects, has proposed a theory concerning the Emergency Cellular Restoration Unit functionality. The ECRU frame likely houses a reservoir containing a regenerative crimson liquid that stimulates human tissue repair. The accompanying medical clipboard potentially tracks the liquid's depletion and indicates the urgency of refilling. When a refill is necessary, next subject's tissues will be consumed to produce liquid. The outcome for the subject depends on the volume required, with a potential risk of fatality. A portion of the liquid might be used to maintain the functionality of the organic metal frame.

Discussion:
We might be able to use this knowledge to replicate production of this liquid of lower concentration for usage between colonists.
Anomalous medical bed was renamed to Emergency Cellular Restoration Unit.

Recommendations:
Destruction: Given the potential for accidental death on this medical bed, its destruction may be the most prudent course of action.
Controlled Use: Alternatively, if hypothesis is right, then continued use of ECRU, under controlled and monitored conditions, could offer significant advantages in medical care. This approach, however, necessitates thorough risk assessment and the development of safety protocols to safeguard colonists' well-being.

ThingDef.label: industrial metal box
ThingDef.description: This industrial-looking metal box as tall as a table. Several small doors interrupt the smooth surface on its sides, while a big hole with hidden inside blades sits atop it. A lone button rests next to the hole, hinting at some unknown function.

li.AnomalyDesc: This industrial-looking metal box as tall as a table. Several small doors interrupt the smooth surface on its sides, while a big hole with hidden inside blades sits atop it. A lone button rests next to the hole, activating butchering of surounding corpses. It devours entire corpse with its spinning razor-sharp blades, reducing it to fist-sized chunks for efficient butchering.\n\nClassified as Class-0 (Safe) anomaly.
li.label: #1/6 Industrial metal box study report
li.text:
Analysis of an Automated Meat Grinder

Subject: {PAWN_nameDef}

Abstract:
An industrial-looking metal box functioned as an automated meat grinder. Upon activation, it collected nearby corpses, processed them into fist-sized meat and leather chunks, and deactivated after butchering all available corpses. Processed materials exhibited no anomalous properties. The meat grinder's lack of apparent power source warrants further investigation. Classified as Class-0 (Safe).

Observations:
Deceased animal specimens were placed in proximity to the industrial-looking metal box. {PAWN_nameDef} was instructed to press the button. Upon activation, small access doors on the sides automatically opened. A thin, metallic manipulator arms emerged from the access door and deposited corpse into a central processing chamber. Subject reported of hearing sounds of corpse being cut and crushed. Fist-sized chunks of processed meat and leather were ejected from one of the access doors. After some time, when there was no corpses left around it, it deactivated itself.

Outcome:
All deceased animal specimens around metal box were successfully butchered. Analysis of the processed meat and leather revealed no anomalous properties.

Discussion:
Industrial-looking metal box appears to function as an automated meat grinder. Activation via a button triggers the retrieval of corpses, butchering, and expulsion of processed materials. It doesn't seems to require any power input, reason of which requires further investigation.
Temporary meat grinder has been classified as Class-0 (Safe) anomaly.

Recommendations:
Further observation is required to explore it other possible anomalous effects.

li.AnomalyDesc:
This industrial-looking metal box as tall as a table. Several small doors interrupt the smooth surface on its sides, while a big hole with hidden inside blades sits atop it. A lone button rests next to the hole, activating butchering of surounding corpses. It devours entire corpse with its spinning razor-sharp blades, reducing it to fist-sized chunks for efficient butchering.

Produces sound, which indicate it butchering efficiency and can cause injury to the user.

Classified as Class-1 (Caution) anomaly.
li.label: #2/6 Industrial metal box study report
li.text:
Unveiling the Sound-Efficiency Link

Subject: [REDACTED]

Abstract:
Previously safe meat grinder exhibited aggressive behavior during routine testing. A weak, previously unnoticed sound correlated with reaction from manipulator that injured personnel. Butchering efficiency appears to be linked to the sound, with higher sound levels leading to increased output. The anomaly has been reclassified as Class-1 (Caution) due to safety concerns. Further investigation is required to understand the sound's role and prevent future incidents.

Observations:
A weak sound was reported emanating from the meat grinder. Standard experiment procedures were initiated. Upon activation attempt, an access door opened unexpectedly, and a manipulator arm pushed [REDACTED] towards the processing chamber. Subject experienced increased stress and sustained a bleeding hand injury. Meat grinder continued its processing function as observed in previous experiments. The weak sound reportedly disappeared after a few corpses were butchered.

Outcome:
[REDACTED] lost a finger due to the incident.
Maximum sound level measured 40 dB.
The amount of processed meat and leather increased compared to previous experiments that lacked the sound.

Discussion:
The potential for harm appears linked to the previously unnoticed weak sound emanating from the meat grinder. The sound level might influence the efficiency of the butchering process. Sound level decrease with amount of corpses processed by the meat grinder.
Reclassified meat grinder as Class-1 (Caution) anomaly.

Considerations:
This incident highlights a significant shift in the anomaly's behavior compared to earlier observations. Its potential to cause harm poses a serious threat to personnel safety.

Recommendations:
Further observation is crucial to understand the sound's role in the process.

li.label: #3/6 Industrial metal box study report
li.text:
Sound as a Predictor of Injury

Subject: [REDACTED]

Abstract:
Experiments revealed a concerning link between sound level and injury risk during activation of an anomalous meat grinder. Higher sound levels (0 dB = safe, 90 dB = critical limb loss) correlated with increased injury severity. The grinder's sound level appears to rise over time, suggesting potentially even greater dangers. Notably, processing human corpses seems to temporarily reduce the sound similar to using multiple animal specimens. Extreme caution and sound monitoring are crucial before activation.

Observations:
Multiple experiments were conducted, with a focus on recording sound levels during operation.

Outcome:
A clear correlation was observed between sound level and the severity of injuries sustained by [REDACTED] during activation attempts:
- 0 dB = Safe (100%)
- 40 dB = Finger loss (125%)
- 60 dB = Hand or Foot loss (175%)
- 90 dB = Leg or Arm loss (225%)

Discussion:
Higher sound levels appear to correlate with a greater risk of the subject being drawn into the processing chamber and sustaining severe injuries. The sound level generated by the meat grinder seems to rise over time, suggesting a potential for even higher sound levels (beyond the observed 90 dB).
Interestingly, processing human corpses appears to temporarily reduce the sound level similar to using multiple similar animal corpses.

Recommendations:
Extreme caution is advised before activating the meat grinder. Personnel should prioritize monitoring sound levels during operation.

li.AnomalyDesc:
This industrial-looking metal box as tall as a table. Several small doors interrupt the smooth surface on its sides, while a big hole with hidden inside blades sits atop it. A lone button rests next to the hole, activating butchering of surounding corpses. It devours entire corpse with its spinning razor-sharp blades, reducing it to fist-sized chunks for efficient butchering.

Produces sound, which indicate it butchering efficiency and can cause injury to the user. When sound level higher than 0, it can attract clueless humans to itself for consumption.

li.label: #4/6 Industrial metal box study report
li.text:
Security Breach and Tragedy

Subject: [REDACTED]

Abstract:
Unauthorized access to meat grinder resulted in a lethal incident. Subject [REDACTED] exhibited atypical behavior before activation and jumping into the machine. A one hour window for intervention was observed. Maximum sound level reached 130 dB before dropping significantly after subject perished. The meat grinder has been reclassified as Class-2 (Warning) due to the potential for self-harm of personel. Focus on increased security and monitoring of containment room is recommended.

Observations:
Security footage identified [REDACTED] entering the meat grinder containment area without authorization. During this unauthorized access, [REDACTED] exhibited unusual behavior, including humming and staring intently at the machine for approximately one hour. Subject then activated the meat grinder and jumped into the central processing chamber.
A facility janitor discovered blood on the containment room floor during a routine cleaning and raised the alarm.

Outcome:
Maximum sound level recorded during the incident was 130 dB. Sound levels dropped significantly following the disappearance of [REDACTED] within the machine. Butcher efficiency reached 300%.

Discussion:
This incident necessitates a reevaluation of the potential risks associated with the meat grinder.
The approximately one hour timeframe between initial interaction and activation suggests potential avenues for intervention before it too late for the subject.
Reclassified meat grinder as Class-2 (Warning) anomaly, due to incident with [REDACTED].

Recommendations:
Facility should be put on high alert and Overseers should be vigilant in monitoring all activity near the containment room to prevent future lethal incidents.
Further investigation is essential to understand the potential factors influencing anomalous behavior in personnel interacting with the meat grinder.

li.label: #5/6 Industrial metal box study report
li.text:
Isolation Attempt

Abstract:
This report details an attempt to isolate meat grinder within a sealed containment room. Following [REDACTED] hours of isolation, personnel reported widespread auditory hallucinations. Despite the absence of detectable sound, subjective reports indicated proximate vocalizations. Morale declined significantly, necessitating the termination of isolation and resumption of standard feeding protocols. Auditory hallucinations ceased post-feeding.

Observations:
Meat grinder was subjected to isolation protocol within containment room [REDACTED]. Chamber was sealed, restricting any access.
Following a period of [REDACTED] hours post-isolation, personnel throughout the facility reported auditory hallucinations characterized by persistent, high-volume vocalizations, similar to singing. Subjective descriptions indicated the perceived source of the vocalizations was proximate to the individual, regardless of physical location.
Auditory analysis of recordings taken next to any personel revealed no sound readings.

Outcome:
Facility-wide morale exhibited a precipitous decline, attributed to the sustained auditory disruption.
Following a period of [REDACTED] hours of continued auditory disruption, and after some consideration, containment room [REDACTED] was unsealed.
Standard feeding protocol of meat grinder was implemented.
Auditory hallucinations ceased within [REDACTED] hours of feeding protocol completion.

Discussion:
The isolation protocol proved ineffective in containing the anomalous properties of meat grinder.
The auditory hallucinations manifested independently of physical proximity to the meat grinder, suggesting a non-localized anomalous effect.

Recommendations:
Revised containment protocols should avoid prolonged isolation.
Further investigation is essential to understand the potential factors influencing anomalous behavior in personnel interacting with the meat grinder.
