li.label: #6/6 Industrial metal box study report
li.text:
Theory Regarding Meat Grinder

Subject: [REDACTED]

Abstract:
Drilling into the anomalous Symphony of Eternal Slaughter revealed human organs and a brain sustained by an organic-metallic life support system. Scans matched the internal sounds with humming reported during a prior unauthorized access lethal incident. A hypothesis proposes a dissected person inside psychically attracts and consumes others for self-preservation, with stress levels impacting processing efficiency. Distraction may disrupt control. Destruction is recommended due to safety concerns, though controlled use offers potential benefits if risks are mitigated.

Observations:
[REDACTED] utilized drilling equipment to create an opening in one of the meat grinder's access doors. Following the initial drilling, blood was observed leaking from the interior of the machine. [REDACTED] reported hearing a heartbeat and witnessing muscle contractions within the meat grinder.
Scans were conducted through the newly created opening, revealing the presence of human organs and a brain inside.

Outcome:
The scans revealed human organs, including a brain, located within the organic metal core of the meat grinder. These organs appear to be maintained by a life support system constructed from a network of twisted flesh.
Additional sound analysis revealed similarities between the detected sounds and the humming reported by [REDACTED] during the unauthorized access incident.

Hypothesis:
Based on the report by [REDACTED], the following theory regarding the Symphony of Eternal Slaughter is proposed by one of observers. A dissected human is contained within the organic metal core of the machine, with their organs and brain kept functional through a life support system. This potentially reflects an unorthodox method, employed by archotech scientists, to automate the butchering process without rellying on artificial intelligence. To maintain itself, this person might utilize a form of singing on psychic level to attract living humans. Consumed alive humans or their body parts may be used to sustain the person by providing bodily fluids and cells, allowing for self-sustenance. Increased stress levels within the person could potentially correlate with higher processing efficiency, possibly as a means of attracting attention and ensure flow of corpses and bodies.

Discussion:
It is theorized that effective distraction of a subject affected by the singing could potentially disrupt control of the meat grinder and prevent a lethal incident.

Recommendations:
Removal: Given the potential for accidental death, it destruction maybe the best coarse of action. This approach could also potentially provide access to samples of meat grinder person's body parts from it.
Controlled Use: Alternatively, if hypothesis is right, then continued use of meat grinder, under controlled and monitored conditions, could offer substantial benefits in terms of corpse butchering. This approach, however, necessitates thorough risk assessment and the development of safety protocols to safeguard colonists' well-being.

li.activateDescString: Deconstruct and fully disassemble. [Will destroy it]

ThingDef.label: transmitter
ThingDef.description: A small device with pneumatic retractable stops. On its body there are indicators with lights, an antenna and a small button.\n\nIt looks like military grade.

li.AnomalyDesc: A military grade small device for transferring data with pneumatic retractable stops to hold it still on ground. On its body there are indicators with lights and a small button. A compact antenna constantly sending and recieving data from somewhere.\n\nClassified as Class-0 (Safe) anomaly.
li.label: #1/5 Transmitter study report
li.text:
Unexplained Data Transmission and Indestructibility

Subject: {PAWN_nameDef}

Abstract:
Anomalous metallic transmitter device withstood physical and thermal stress testing. While exhibiting data transmission, it displayed no hostility. Further investigation is recommended to understand its function and potential risks associated with the data transfer. Transmitter is tentatively classified as Class-0 (Safe).

Observations:
Subject was presented with a mining drill. {PAWN_nameDef} attempt to compromise the structural integrity of transmitter was unsuccessful.
{PAWN_nameDef} exposed transmitter to a controlled fire for 30 minutes. Upon extinguishing the fire, the transmitter exhibited no signs of charring or melting.
Subject reported seeing only one lit lamp on the indicator.

Outcome:
Throughout the testing procedures, transmitter displayed no hostile reaction.
Sensor readings throughout the experiment indicated continuous data transfer from and to transmitter.

Discussion:
The transmitter appears to possess anomalous properties rendering it indestructible by conventional means.
The purpose of the lamps and the digital dial on the indicator remains unclear.
Constant data exchange of transmitter with something unknown must be reviewed closely.
The continuous data transfer between transmitter and an unknown source necessitates further investigation to determine potential consequences.
Temporary transmitter has been classified as Class-0 (Safe) anomaly.

Recommendations:
Continued surveillance of transmitter is recommended to explore the possibility of consequences of such uncontrolled data transfere.

li.AnomalyDesc:
A military grade small device for transferring data with pneumatic retractable stops to hold it still on ground. On its body there are indicators with lights and a small button. A compact antenna constantly sending and recieving data from somewhere.

After recieving enough data will teleport to a location nearby and initiate high intensity energy beam attack on itself once digital dial timer reach zero.

Classified as Class-2 (Warning) anomaly.
li.label: #2/5 Transmitter study report
li.text:
Teleportation and High-Energy Beam

Subject: [REDACTED]

Abstract:
Anomalous transmitter breached containment via teleportation after receiving unknown data. Subsequent high-intensity energy beam attack caused extensive environmental damage. Transmitter recovered undamaged. Transmitter's self-teleportation and data link to destructive potential necessitate Class-2 (Warning) classification. Continuous monitoring and relocation protocols are crucial to mitigate future threats.

Observations:
Security footage captured the appearance of a countdown timer on the digital dial of transmitter, after which it teleported out of its containment area, with only one indicator lamp illuminated.
A separate camera recorded the transmitter's reappearance outside the facility.
Following the countdown completion, security personnel [REDACTED] within the facility reported a sudden increase in ambient light, resembling high noon, despite recorded footage indicating it was nighttime.
Camera footage confirmed a high-intensity energy beam originating from the sky, incinerating a large area encompassing local flora and fauna.
The beam dissipated after approximately one hour, leaving the transmitter unscathed on the ground.

Outcome:
No personnel, including [REDACTED], were injured during the incident due to the transmitter's prior teleportation. However, extensive environmental damage occurred within the affected area.
The number of illuminated indicator lamps on the transmitter changed after retrieval and relocation to the containment area. No physical damage was observed.

Discussion:
This dangerous incident underscores the significant danger posed by transmitter. The continuous data exchange with an unknown source appears strongly linked to the high-energy beam attack.
While the beam appears to target the transmitter location upon countdown completion, this could be exploited for damage mitigation by relocating it to a nearby uninhabited area.
Unfortunately, the transmitter self-teleportation ability renders this strategy unreliable.
The extent of the transmitter teleportation range is unknown, necessitating preparedness for potential teleportation within the facility.
Reclassified transmitter as Class-2 (Warning) anomaly, due to the demonstrated destructive capabilities.

Recommendations:
Meticulous monitoring of both the transmitter physical location and the displayed time on the digital dial is essential to prevent the energy beam from impacting the facility's interior.
In the event of an internal teleportation, immediate intervention is advised, involving personnel retrieving the transmitter and relocating it outside vital areas.

li.AnomalyDesc:
A military grade small device for transferring data with pneumatic retractable stops to hold it still on ground. On its body there are indicators with lights and a small button. A compact antenna constantly sending and recieving data from somewhere.

After recieving enough data will teleport to a location nearby and initiate high intensity energy beam attack on itself once digital dial timer reach zero. Lit lamps on the indicator show the amount of beams that will be utilized. Colonists have 2 hours to pick and move it to somewhere safe. Then they will have 12 min to leave the danger zone.

Classified as Class-4 (Critical) anomaly.
li.label: #3/5 Transmitter study report
li.text:
Multiple Beams and Timer Delay

Subject: [REDACTED]

Abstract:
Anomaly transmitter breached containment and teleported within the facility. Relocation efforts revealed a critical detail: holding a button on the base extends the initial countdown and triggers a short secondary timer upon release. The anomaly fires multiple beams based on indicator lights, with the first targeting itself and subsequent beams hitting random nearby locations. This significantly increases potential damage. Anomaly reclassified as Class-4 (Critical). Stricter surveillance and mandatory button holding during emergency relocation are recommended.

Observations:
Security footage captured the teleportation of transmitter with three indicator lights illuminated. It materialized within the facility's storage room, in proximity to [REDACTED].
Following established protocol, Subject retrieved the transmitter despite encountering resistance from its retractable stops. [REDACTED] then left facility with the transmitter in hands. The digital dial displayed a 2 hour countdown timer.
After exceeding the 2 hour mark, Subject relocated the transmitter to a deserted area before departing at high speed. Long-range camera footage confirmed the subsequent activation of three high-energy beams impacting the area where the transmitter was previously located.

Outcome:
During post-incident questioning regarding continued movement beyond the 2 hour countdown, [REDACTED] revealed that upon releasing the transmitter, the digital dial was displaying a remaining 12-minute timer. Additionally, unintentional activation of a small button on the transmitter base was reported.
Post-event analysis confirmed 2 out of the 3 energy beams struck locations slightly away from the transmitter spot, evident by 3 distinct, overlapping scorched circles on the ground.

Discussion:
This incident suggests a method to manipulate the initial countdown timer. Continuous pressure applied to a button located on the base of transmitter seemingly extends the two-hour window, providing additional time for relocation. It appears the initial countdown serves as a buffer period unless the button is activated. Once released, a 12-minute timer initiates, prompting personnel to evacuate the immediate vicinity.
Furthermore, the number of illuminated indicator lights appears directly proportional to the quantity of energy beams fired. While the first beam targets the transmitter location, subsequent beams seem to strike random targets within a short radius around it. This significantly increases the potential area of effect and raises concerns about possible undetected activations within the facility itself.
Reclassified transmitter as Class-4 (Critical) anomaly, due to the enhanced destructive capabilities and the potential for wide range damage to facility.

Recommendations:
Surveillance of transmitter must be prioritized and elevated to the highest level.
The containment protocol should be amended to mandate the continuous pressing of the button located on the base of the transmitter during emergency relocation procedures.

li.AnomalyDesc:
A military grade small device for transferring data with pneumatic retractable stops to hold it still on ground. On its body there are indicators with lights and a small button. A compact antenna constantly sending and recieving data from somewhere.

After recieving enough data will teleport to a location nearby and initiate high intensity energy beam attack on itself once digital dial timer reach zero. Lit lamps on the indicator show the amount of beams that will be utilized. Colonists have 2 hours to pick and move it to somewhere safe. It will not activate as long as the carrier keep holding down the button. Then they will have 12 min to leave the danger zone. Can be manually activated.

Classified as Class-4 (Critical) anomaly.
li.label: #4/5 Transmitter study report
li.text:
Manual Activation and Combat Application

Subject: [REDACTED]

Abstract:
Testing transmitter revealed a manual activation method via its base button. Holding the button halts the countdown timer, but accidental release triggers a 12-minute countdown to self-activation. The incident highlights the dangers of transporting the transmitter and the potential for weaponized use. Updated protocols will consider combat applications, while emphasizing safety measures.

Observations:
Transmitter was transported to a designated outdoor testing area for further experimentation.
During initial interaction, [REDACTED] attempted to activate the button located on the base of the transmitter while the digital timer was inactive.
This action unexpectedly initiated a 12-minute countdown on the digital dial.
Subject then retrieved the transmitter and maintained pressure on the button, successfully halting the countdown timer at 12 minutes.
While attempting to transport the transmitter to a designated location for a controlled attack test, [REDACTED] tripped, causing her leg to become lodged in a crevice in the ground.
The transmitter fell from Subject's grasp and landed at a distance beyond immediate reach.
Upon landing, transmitter's pneumatic retractable stops deployed, preventing retrieval attempts using a nearby stick.
As the 12-minute timer expired, a high-intensity energy beam struck the transmitter location, consistent with previous observations.

Outcome:
Tragically, [REDACTED] succumbed to the effects of the energy beam at the incident location, with only residual ash recovered.

Discussion:
This unforeseen event, while being tragic, provided valuable insights into the transmitter functionality.
The experiment inadvertently revealed a method for manual activation through interaction with the button. This opens potential avenues for controlled applications in combat scenarios.
The incident also highlighted the inherent risks associated with transporting the transmitter, even in a activating state. Accidental release of a button can trigger the countdown timer, posing a serious threat to the carrier, if they stay nearby.
Furthermore, the activation of the pneumatic retractable stops upon landing suggests internal sensors that detect solid ground, which makes retrieval after accidental release more challenging.

Recommendations:
The established protocols for transmitter should be amended to include authorization for its controlled use in combat situations. However, the inherent risks associated with such deployment must be carefully considered and addressed through thorough training and safety protocols.

li.AnomalyDesc:
A military grade small device targetting power-collection satellites during training excercise. It pneumatic retractable stops allows it to hold still on ground. On its body there are indicators with lights and a small safety button. A compact antenna constantly sending and recieving data from satellites.

After recieving enough data will teleport to a location nearby, preferably inside buildings, and initiate high intensity energy beam attack on itself once digital dial timer reach zero. Lit lamps on the indicator show the amount of beams that will be utilized. Colonists have 2 hours to pick and move it to somewhere safe. It will not activate as long as the carrier keep holding down the button. Then they will have 12 min to leave the danger zone. Can be manually activated each 5 days.

Classified as Class-4 (Critical) anomaly.
li.label: #5/5 Transmitter study report
li.text:
Theory Regarding Transmitter

Abstract:
Analysis of the Orbital Beam Training Target (OBTT) suggests its origin as an archeotech device for coordinating power satellites. The bottom button likely served as a safety measure for personnel. The OBTT exhibits concerning modifications: self-repair via organic material and teleportation based on satellite data (prioritizing buildings). While potentially repurposable as a weapon, its critical classification remains due to safety risks and teleportation capabilities. Removal or controlled use require careful consideration due to inherent risks.

Hypothesis:
Based on observations from all experiments and data from transmission, a theory regarding the Orbital Beam Training Target (OBTT) origin and behavior was proposed.
OBTT was build by archotech engineers to test and coordinate network of multiple power-collection satellites. Lit lamps on the indicator represent the amount of satellites it was able to connect. While digital dial represent time it takes for satellites to aim at the OBTT as the target. Additional safety feature was installed in it as button at the bottom, which allowed ground personal to delay attack to evacuate firing zone. Strong pneumatic retractable stops was installed to keep OBTT in one place during beam effect. While it was made of military grade composite to withstand multiple usage, it appears to have undergone alterations. Seems like organic metal infestated the device making it to regenerate any damage from beam. Additionally it acquired ability to self-teleport. Target of teleportation selected via processing of big amount of recieved data from satellite imaging, to prioritize building as targets. Due to the interference in the atmosphere satellite imaging not always available, making it pick random spot nearby to teleport to. Since it was made for military practice it doesn't risk being permamently deactivated by the satellites, but still require some time (~5 days) between manual activation.

Discussion:
Based on our current understanding of the OBTT, it has the potential to be repurposed as a powerful military-grade tool. Additionally, its self-teleportation ability requires a high level of surveillance capability for preventive measures against activation in vital facility zones.
The current classification of the OBTT remains Class-4 (Critical) as it still pose an immediate threat to the facility and it personal, even with current safety protocols.

Recommendations:
Removal: Given the potential for it indestructability, destruction is impossible but it can be send to the other part of the world. The OBTT teleportation abilities still present a risk of it returning to the facility one day.
Controlled Use: If the hypothesis holds true, continued utilization of the OBTT under controlled and monitored conditions could offer a sustainable fire power for the facility defense. This approach, however, requires thorough risk assessment and robust safety protocols to prevent it activation in vital zones.

li.activateDescString: Modify satellite data to make it teleport far away from the colony. [Will destroy it]

ThingDef.label: strange puddle
ThingDef.description: A dark, viscous crimson pool, oozing and spreading, a stark contrast to the surrounding environment.

li.AnomalyDesc: A dark, viscous crimson pool, oozing and spreading, a stark contrast to the surrounding environment. The substance within is a blood-like liquid, composed primarily of blood with a bioferrite admixture.\n\nClassified as Class-0 (Safe) anomaly.
li.label: #1/3 Blood Puddle study report
li.text:
Liquid Analysis

Subject: {PAWN_nameDef}

Abstract:
A strange puddle exhibiting anomalous properties was discovered. The substance within resembled blood, but had color of a significantly lower oxygen concentration. As sampling depth increased, the liquid's density grew, reaching a point of impenetrability at one meter. Analysis revealed a composition primarily composed of blood with a bioferrite admixture. Given its non-hostile nature and unique density-shifting properties, the puddle has been temporarily classified as a Class-0 (Safe) anomaly. Further investigation is recommended to fully understand its potential applications and anomalous characteristics.

Observations:
Upon examination of the strange puddle, {PAWN_nameDef} observed that the substance within resembled blood, though with a notably low oxygen concentration.
Multiple test tubes were filled with samples extracted from various depths.
{PAWN_nameDef} reported a significant increase in liquid density at greater depths, making extraction increasingly difficult.

Outcome:
Throughout the sampling process, puddle displayed no hostile reaction.
Analysis of the collected samples revealed a composition approximately 90% identical to standard blood, with the addition of bioferrite.
At a depth of 1 meter, the liquid's density became too high to permit further extraction.

Discussion:
The blood-like liquid in the strange puddle appears to possess the ability to dynamically adjust its density, with increasing depth correlating to higher density.
This unique property suggests the potential for bioferrite separation from blood-like liquid.
Given the lack of hostile behavior, puddle has been temporary classified as Class-0 (Safe) anomaly.

Recommendations:
Continued monitoring of the puddle is recommended to further investigate its anomalous properties and explore potential applications.

li.AnomalyDesc: A dark, viscous crimson pool, oozing and spreading, a stark contrast to the surrounding environment. The substance within is a blood-like liquid, composed primarily of blood with a bioferrite admixture. Decrease in liquid density imply the iminent hostile entity attack.\n\nClassified as Class-1 (Caution) anomaly.
li.label: #2/3 Blood Puddle study report
li.text:
Density Decreasing

Subject: {PAWN_nameDef}

Abstract:
A significant change in the previously observed anomalous blood-like liquid in the puddle has been detected. The liquid's density has decreased, potentially allowing for deeper exploration. However, the presence of hostile entities within the puddle has been confirmed through physical attacks on the sampling equipment. This shift in behavior has necessitated a reclassification to Class-1 (Caution). Further investigation and preparation for potential threats are recommended.

Observations:
A significant change in the blood puddle was observed by {PAWN_nameDef}.
The liquid within now more closely resembles standard blood, exhibiting a higher oxygen concentration.
Subject repeated the sampling process, extracting liquid from various depths.
Unexpectedly, at a depth of 1 meter, the previously dense liquid offered no resistance, nearly causing {PAWN_nameDef} to fall into the puddle.
At a depth of 5 meters, the sampling device was physically damaged, but test tube was safely extracted.

Outcome:
Analysis of the collected samples revealed a substantial decrease in the blood-like liquid's density.
The sampling device showed multiple bite marks on it surface, indicating the presence of a dangerous creature within the puddle.

Discussion:
The rapid decrease in blood-like liquid density suggests a potential pathway opening deeper into the puddle.
This raises concerns about the possibility of hostile entities residing within and their ability to breach the surface.
In light of these developments, the puddle's classification has been elevated to Class-1 (Caution) anomaly.

Recommendations:
Preparations should be made for a potential encounter with hostile entities originating from the blood puddle.

li.AnomalyDesc:
A dark, viscous crimson pool, oozing and spreading, a stark contrast to the surrounding environment. The substance within is a blood-like liquid, composed primarily of blood with a bioferrite admixture. Decrease in liquid density imply the iminent emergence of fleshbeasts.

Density = Time till fleshbeasts emergence:
13590 kg/m3 = 2 days
3120 kg/m3 = 1 day
1839 kg/m3 = 8 hours
1060 kg/m3 = 1 hour

Classified as Class-2 (Warning) anomaly.
li.label: #3/3 Blood Puddle study report
li.text:
Continuation of the Study is Not Possible

Abstract:
A hazardous blood-like puddle was observed to exhibit anomalous properties, including the emergence of fleshbeasts. Attempts to investigate and contain the puddle were hindered by its unique characteristics, such as rapid density fluctuations. The puddle's classification has been elevated to Class-2 (Warning) due to the potential threat posed by the fleshbeasts. Further research is not possible, but development of containment and extraction methods, is necessary to utilize this anomaly.

Observations:
A series of measurements were recorded during and subsequent to the emergence of fleshbeasts from the puddle.
Attempts to excavate beneath the puddle to identify the source of the creatures were unsuccessful.
Similarly, efforts to fill the puddle with soil proved ineffective.

Outcome:
The lowest recorded density of the blood-like liquid was observed during the emergence of the fleshbeasts, reaching a value of 1060 kg/m³.
Following the encounter, the liquid's density rapidly increased.
Excavation attempts revealed that the puddle's external dimensions significantly underestimated its internal depth. The puddle's external appearance was misleading, as its depth was much greater than its surface area.
Furthermore, any soil introduced into the puddle was pushed outward by the blood-like liquid.

Discussion:
While the number of emerging fleshbeasts did not pose an immediate threat to the facility, individual colonists working nearby could be at risk during future emergence events.
Observed correlation between density and time till fleshbeasts emergence:
13590 kg/m3 = 2 days
3120 kg/m3 = 1 day
1839 kg/m3 = 8 hours
1060 kg/m3 = 1 hour
The small size of the puddle results in rapid density increases after fleshbeast emergence, hindering further exploration.
Our scientists have developed a dissolvent chemicals capable of counteracting the increasing surface density, allowing us to fill it with soil.
Reclassified puddle as Class-2 (Warning) anomaly.

Hypothesis:
{PAWN_nameDef} proposed a theory suggesting a connection between the puddle and a blood-like liquid source in a different plain of reality. The puddle may be analogous to a cut in arteriole, which transporting blood-like liquid. Fleshbeasts may reside within this source and utilize the arterioles for movement. The rapid density increase near exits could be a defensive mechanism, similar to blood coagulation. Unfortunately, the small size of the arterioles prevents human exploration.

Recommendations:
Removal: The use of dissolvent chemicals and soil filling is recommended to eliminate the threat within the facility's territory.
Controlled Use: A controlled collection system, utilizing a blood-like liquid pump, is suggested for potential future applications.
Security: Additional security units should be deployed to respond to future fleshbeast emergence events.

li.activateDescString: Add chemicals to dissolve and fill it with soil. [Will destroy it]

ThingDef.label: strange lake
ThingDef.description: A dark, viscous giant crimson pool, oozing and spreading, a stark contrast to the surrounding environment.

li.AnomalyDesc: A dark, viscous giant crimson pool, oozing and spreading, a stark contrast to the surrounding environment. The substance within is a blood-like liquid, composed primarily of blood with a bioferrite admixture. Occasiounally small fleshbeasts will emerge from it.\n\nClassified as Class-2 (Warning) anomaly.
li.label: #1/8 Blood Lake study report
li.text:
Liquid Analysis

Subject: {PAWN_nameDef}

Abstract:
A large, anomalous blood-like lake has been discovered, exhibiting similar characteristics to a previously encountered blood puddle anomaly. The lake contains a blood-like substance with a bioferrite admixture and poses a potential threat due to the emergence of fleshbeasts. Despite the increased size and depth, the lake remains a hazardous environment requiring careful monitoring and security measures. Further research is necessary to understand its origins, potential applications, and the nature of the fleshbeast threat.

Observations:
Upon examination of the strange lake, {PAWN_nameDef} observed that the substance within resembled blood, though with a notably low oxygen concentration.
Multiple test tubes were filled with samples extracted from various depths.
{PAWN_nameDef} reported a significant increase in liquid density at greater depths, making extraction increasingly difficult.
The Subject noted similarities between this lake and the previously studied blood puddle anomaly.

Outcome:
During the sampling process, lake displayed no hostile reaction. However, the sampling device sustained multiple bite marks.
Analysis of the collected samples revealed a composition approximately 90% identical to standard blood, with the addition of bioferrite.
At a depth of 10 meter, the liquid's density became too high to permit further extraction.

Discussion:
Comparative analysis of the blood-like liquid from the lake and archived samples from the blood puddle anomaly yielded a 100% match.
This, coupled with the damage to the sampling device, suggests a strong connection between the two anomalies. This connection implies that some fleshbeasts may be capable of reaching the surface, even under high-density conditions.
The larger size of the lake offers a greater potential for blood-like liquid extraction.
Temporary strange lake has been classified as Class-2 (Warning) anomaly.

Recommendations:
Study: Continued monitoring of the lake is recommended to further investigate its anomalous properties and explore potential applications.
Security: Additional security units should be deployed to respond to potential fleshbeast emergence events.

li.AnomalyDesc: A dark, viscous giant crimson pool, oozing and spreading, a stark contrast to the surrounding environment. The substance within is a blood-like liquid, composed primarily of blood with a bioferrite admixture. Occasiounally small fleshbeasts will emerge from it. Decrease in liquid density imply the iminent emergence of fleshbeasts.\n\nClassified as Class-3 (Danger) anomaly.
li.label: #2/8 Blood Lake study report
li.text:
Rapid Density Decrease

Subject: [REDACTED]

Abstract:
A significant change in the blood lake has been observed, indicating an impending fleshbeast emergence. The lake's size and lower density suggest a potentially larger and more dangerous outbreak compared to previous incidents. The anomaly's classification has been elevated to Class-3 (Danger) to reflect the increased threat level. Continued monitoring and enhanced security measures are crucial to mitigate the potential risks.

Observations:
A significant change in the blood lake was observed by {PAWN_nameDef}.
The liquid within now more closely resembles standard blood, exhibiting a higher oxygen concentration.
Subject repeated the sampling process, extracting liquid from various depths.
At a depth of 50 meters, the sampling device encountered a region of high density.

Outcome:
Analysis of the collected samples revealed a substantial decrease in the blood-like liquid's density.

Discussion:
The blood lake appears to be following a similar density fluctuation pattern to the previously observed blood puddle. This suggests an impending emergence of fleshbeasts.
However, due to the lake's larger size and lower overall density, a significantly larger number of fleshbeasts are anticipated.
In light of these developments, the lake's classification has been elevated to Class-3 (Danger) anomaly.

Recommendations:
Study: Continued monitoring of the lake, especially during and after fleshbeast emergence, is crucial.
Security: Substantial security reinforcements should be deployed to address the potential threat posed by a large-scale fleshbeast emergence.

li.AnomalyDesc: A dark, viscous giant crimson pool, oozing and spreading, a stark contrast to the surrounding environment. The substance within is a blood-like liquid, composed primarily of blood with a bioferrite admixture. Occasiounally small fleshbeasts will emerge from it. Decrease in liquid density imply the iminent emergence of big group of fleshbeasts.\n\nClassified as Class-4 (Critical) anomaly.
li.label: #3/8 Blood Lake study report
li.text:
Outcome of Encounter

Abstract:
A significant change in the anomalous blood lake has been observed, with a decrease in the high-density region. This development suggests a potential increase in the threat level, as it may facilitate the emergence of a larger number of fleshbeasts. The lake's classification has been elevated to Class-4 (Critical) to reflect this heightened risk. Further investigation, including the deployment of underwater drones, is necessary to understand the source and nature of the fleshbeast threat.

Outcome:
Post-encounter, depth sensors indicated that the high-density region at the 50-meter depth was no longer detectable.

Discussion:
It is possible that a significant number of fleshbeasts have passed through the high-density region, leading to its depletion.
This development may allow for deeper exploration of the lake.
To better understand the origin of the fleshbeasts, deploying an underwater drone is recommended.
Given the significant threat posed by potential fleshbeast emergences, the lake's classification has been elevated to Class-4 (Critical) anomaly.

Hypothesis:
{PAWN_nameDef} proposed a theory building upon the existing blood puddle hypothesis. While puddle can be compared to an arteriole of blood-like liquid system, the Lake can be compared to an aorta. Due to its larger size, the lake exhibits reduced coagulation properties and increased blood-like liquid flow capacity, enabling the passage of larger groups of fleshbeasts. This increased size may also allow for human exploration.

Recommendations:
Study: Deploying an underwater drone is recommended to investigate the source of the fleshbeasts.
Security: Preparation for potential large-scale fleshbeast emergences in the future is crucial.

li.AnomalyDesc:
A dark, viscous giant crimson pool, oozing and spreading, a stark contrast to the surrounding environment. The substance within is a blood-like liquid, composed primarily of blood with a bioferrite admixture. Occasiounally small fleshbeasts will emerge from it. Decrease in liquid density imply the iminent emergence of big group of fleshbeasts.

Can be entered for an expedition.

Classified as Class-4 (Critical) anomaly.
li.label: #4/8 Blood Lake study report
li.text:
Drone Usage Result

Subject: Underwater drone

Abstract:
A daring underwater exploration of the blood lake has yielded surprising results. A remote-operated drone successfully penetrated the depths, encountering hostile lifeforms and unusual environmental conditions. The discovery of a breathable air pocket on the other side of the lake suggests a potential path for human exploration. However, the presence of aggressive creatures and the unknown nature of the deeper regions necessitate careful planning and preparation for future expedition.

Observations:
An underwater drone was deployed into the blood-like liquid. The drone’s primary functions were tested and confirmed operational.
As the drone descended, it passed the 50-meter depth mark, encountering and avoiding several small fleshbeasts.
At the 100-meter depth, the drone was briefly attacked by medium-sized fleshbeasts, but the attack caused minimal damage.
The drone continued its descent, reaching a depth of 250 meters, where a minor malfunction occurred in the orientation system.
At 400 meters, a small fleshbeast attached itself to the drone, puncturing its outer shell. Surprisingly, the drone did not experience the expected pressure-related damage at this depth.
The drone reached a depth of 450 meters, but a power source issue, likely caused by the previous attack, limited its operational range to approximately 70 meters.
At the 500-meter mark, the drone unexpectedly surfaced.
A scan of the surrounding area revealed an air pocket suitable for human respiration. The drone's lidar system, limited in range, provided a partial scan of the area, which appeared dimly lit.
Before communication was lost, the drone detected signs of moving heat signatures approaching its position.

Discussion:
The emergence of the drone suggests the existence of a surface area on the opposite side of the blood lake. The nature of this area, whether open or enclosed, remains uncertain.
However, the lack of pressure-related damage to the drone at extreme depths indicates that the blood-like liquid's density is not directly correlated with depth.
The presence of breathable air on the other side suggests potential for human exploration without additional protective gear.
The final moments of the drone's transmission indicate the presence of potential threats in the area.

Recommendations:
Expedition: A manned expedition should be organized to explore the other side of the blood lake. The team should be adequately equipped and prepared for potential fleshbeasts threats.
Development: The development of more durable and resilient armor plating for underwater exploration is recommended.

li.AnomalyDesc:
A dark, viscous giant crimson pool, oozing and spreading, a stark contrast to the surrounding environment. The substance within is a blood-like liquid, composed primarily of blood with a bioferrite admixture. Occasiounally small fleshbeasts will emerge from it. Decrease in liquid density imply the iminent emergence of big group of fleshbeasts.

Can be entered for an expedition to the unknown territory.

Classified as Class-4 (Critical) anomaly.
li.label: #5/8 Blood Lake study report
li.text:
Expedition

Abstract:
A daring expedition into the depths of the blood lake has led to the discovery of a strange, fleshmass-infested world. The exploration team encountered hostile environments, including gravitational anomalies and aggressive fleshbeasts. Despite these challenges, the team successfully breached the high-density region and emerged into an unknown landscape. Further exploration and research are necessary to understand the nature of this alien world and the potential threats it poses.

Observations:
An exploration team, consisting of [REDACTED], entered an experimental submarine equipped to penetrate the high-density regions of the blood lake.
The submarine was successfully deployed and its primary functions tested.
The team began their descent, reaching a depth of 150 meters. The reinforced submarine hull proved effective in defending against multiple attacks from small fleshbeasts.
At 250 meters, the team experienced a sudden shift in gravity, leading to minor injuries. The submarine's orientation system automatically adjusted to the new gravitational vector.
At 425 meters, a large fleshbeast attacked the submarine, puncturing its hull. The crew was able to quickly seal the breach and deter the creature with an electric pulse.
The submarine continued its descent, reaching a depth of 500 meters before surfacing.
After double checking the air, temperature and radiation, exploration team leaving the submarine.
The team observed a dim, cloudy sky and a landscape heavily infested with flesh mass and numerous dormant or active fleshbeasts.
Sensors detected a weak signal in the vicinity.

Outcome:
The exploration team successfully breached the high-density region of the blood lake and emerged into an unknown, flesmass infected environment.

Discussion:
The discovery of a sky and celstial light source, raises significant questions about the nature of the blood lake.
The linear descent of 500 meters suggests a tunnel-like structure, yet the emergence into an open area challenges this assumption.
The pervasive fleshmass and the presence of active fleshbeasts indicate a hostile environment.
The detected signal, potentially originating from a technological device, offers a tantalizing clue about the history and purpose of this location.

Recommendations:
Study: A comprehensive study of the newly discovered location is necessary to understand its nature, origins, and potential threats. This also may help with finding the source of this signal.
Security: We must establish a defensive perimeter and prepare from potential attacks by fleshbeasts.

li.AnomalyDesc:
A dark, viscous giant crimson pool, oozing and spreading, a stark contrast to the surrounding environment. The substance within is a blood-like liquid, composed primarily of blood with a bioferrite admixture. Occasiounally small fleshbeasts will emerge from it. Decrease in liquid density imply the iminent emergence of big group of fleshbeasts.

No longer can be entered for an expedition to the unknown territory.

Classified as Class-4 (Critical) anomaly.
li.label: #8/8 Blood Lake study report
li.text:
The Sacrifice

Abstract:
Communication with personnel on the other side of the blood lake has been lost, and the lake's high-density region has returned to its previous state. While the immediate threat of large-scale fleshbeast incursions has diminished, the lake's inherent instability warrants its continued classification as a Class-4 (Critical) anomaly. To mitigate future risks, the complete neutralization of the lake through the use of a dissolvent chemical is recommended. However, controlled extraction of the blood-like liquid for research and technological applications remains a viable option.

Outcome:
All communication with personnel on the other side of the blood lake has been lost.
Additionally, the high-density region of the lake has returned to a depth of 50 meters.

Discussion:
The apparent closure of the connection to the other side of the blood lake suggests that the threat of large-scale fleshbeast incursions has diminished.
The current classification of Blood Lake remains Class-4 (Critical), even though it no longer pose an immediate threat to personnel within the facility.

Recommendations:
Destruction: The use of the dissolvent chemical, previously employed on the blood puddle, is recommended to permanently eliminate the threat posed by the blood lake.
Controlled Use: Continued extraction of blood-like liquid from the lake remains viable, particularly for applications related to the recently acquired knowledge and technologies.

li.activateDescString: Add chemicals to dissolve and fill it with soil. [Will destroy it]

ThingDef.label: blood lake exit
ThingDef.description: A dark, viscous giant crimson pool, oozing and spreading, a stark contrast to the surrounding environment. This is an exit on the other side from Blood Lake on a territory of our facility. Can be entered to return to our facility.

li.AnomalyLabel: blood lake exit on the other side
li.AnomalyDesc: A dark, viscous giant crimson pool, oozing and spreading, a stark contrast to the surrounding environment. This is an exit on the other side from Blood Lake on a territory of our facility. Can be entered to return to our facility.
li.label: #6/8 Blood Lake study report
li.text:
Fleshmass response

Abstract:
An exploration team encountered a hostile, flesh-infested environment on the other side of the blood lake. The team faced coordinated attacks from fleshbeasts and experienced a sense of déjà vu. Evidence of human infrastructure and a mysterious signal suggest a complex history and potential threat. Further exploration and research are necessary to understand the nature of this world.

Observations:
The exploration team encountered a hostile environment dominated by flesh mass.
The soil beneath their feet was covered in the fleshmass, and they were subjected to continuous attacks from various directions.
The emergence of new fleshbeasts from underground nests suggests a coordinated assault.
Additionally, the team experienced long ranged acid spit attacks, further complicating the situation.
Some team members reported a sense of familiarity with the location, and others discovered dog tags with names resembling their own.

Discussion:
The underground nests, likely of human origin, suggest a pre-existing infrastructure in this location.
The coordinated attacks by the fleshbeasts, including the acid spitters, imply a level of intelligence and organization that may be controlled by a hive mind.
The detected signal, matching our facility's frequency, but it require more time to find the exact location of transmitter.

Recommendations:
Study: We should continue study blood lake exit to learn more about this location and pinpoint the source of detected signal.
Security: The exploration team must maintain a strong defensive perimeter and be prepared for further attacks from fleshbeasts.

li.label: #7/8 Blood Lake study report
li.text:
Strange Coincidence of Blood Lake Exit Location

Abstract:
An exploration team ventured into a flesh-infested reality, discovering a familiar yet distorted landscape. The team encountered hostile environments, including flesh-based creatures and a pervasive flesh mass. Despite these challenges, the team successfully located a distress signal matching the facility's own. Further investigation of the signal source is necessary to understand the nature of this parallel reality and its connection to our own.

Observations:
Some members of the exploration team climbed a nearby mountain to gain a broader perspective of the surrounding terrain.
The team observed that the flesh mass infection extended as far as the eye could see.
A night sky survey was conducted through clear patches in the cloudy sky.
The team successfully located the source of the detected signal, which was identified as an automated distress signal identical to those used in our facility.

Discussion:
Despite the unfamiliar terrain, celestial observations and GPS data indicate that the team remains on the same planet and in the same general location as the facility.
However, the presence of familiar names on recovered dog tags and the maintenance of communication with our facility suggest a probability of a parallel reality.
But what and why happened here? The reasons of this differences between realities remain a mystery.
Signal source might be our only hope to figure this out.

Recommendations:
Study: Prioritize reaching the signal source to gather information about the nature of differences in this reality. This should be main priority of Exploration Team. Information about it location is located on reciever in Blood Lake Exit.
Security: aintain a strong defensive perimeter around the exploration team and ensure their safety during the investigation.

ThingDef.label: terminal
ThingDef.description: A damaged computer terminal. It can be studied to download information from it database.

li.AnomalyDesc: A damaged computer terminal of this facility. It can be studied to download information from it database.
li.label: #1/3 Terminal study report
li.text:
Fleshmass Experiments

Abstract:
A mysterious discovery of a control panel within a hidden facility has led to the recovery of crucial documents, including a researcher's diary. The diary details experiments involving a blood-like substance capable of inducing grotesque mutations in living organisms. The recovered data suggests a potential divergence in timelines between our reality and the one from which these artifacts originated. Further investigation of the facility could provide valuable insights into the nature of these difference from our own reality.

Observations:
A functioning control panel, similar to those used in our facility, was discovered.
The last user, [REDACTED], required a password for access.
The similarity between this individual's name and that of a member [REDACTED] of our facility prompted usage of their password instead.
Remarkably, the password matched that of our [REDACTED].
While many files were corrupted, some remained accessible.

Diary #1:
Researcher [REDACTED]
[**.**.****] Today, we located a source of blood-like liquid and taking it back to facility for experiments.
[**.**.****] This substance has shown remarkable properties. When it was accidently spilled on a corpse, it initiated a mutation process. When I added more liquid, at the end of the mutation process corpse flesh mutated into a somewhat of fleshmass cyst. I tried to use this cyst on a another corpse, but to no avail. It maybe can only work with alive subject.
[**.**.****] Today's subject is an animal of [REDACTED] species. When I tried to apply fleshmass cyst to it, the cyst rejected the body and did not take root.
[**.**.****] I have tested it on so many animals, both alive and dead, but cyst just doesn't want to take root in them. I can't understand why. Even when I tried to use more liquid on animal corpses, it no longer reacted to create a new cyst. What is different? Why is it no longer working? Wait, the original corpse wasn't of an animal, but of an intruder who broke into our storage facility. What if... I need to get permission to test my theory.
[**.**.****] Today I was able to gain access to a new subject that we recently captured. It a human [REDACTED] with a collapsed lung. We had no use for him, so they let me use him as a test subject for my theory. It took root! It took root! It began to slowly mutate.
[**.**.****] I ended up needing to mute the Subject, because he was screaming too much from pain for the whole day. But it was worth it. My theory was right. It mutated into a new lung, if we can even call this fleshmass a lung, but it does the lung's functions, so it should be fine to call it that. I need to make more cysts to test more.
[**.**.****] This new liquid is wonderful. It can affect human flesh and cause mutations. I have been able to mutate so many organs so far, but cyst doesn't seem to react to some organs. I wonder if we could control the end result of the mutation a bit better, because so far, I need to request new Subjects too often.
[**.**.****] Today I was able to force-grow a new organ in a Subject's body. It was creating concentrated acid within itself. But I guess I did something wrong, because after a few hours, organ walls weren't able to contain the acid inside and it went into the Subject's body. Pity that I would need to wait for a new Subject to arrive, but at least I was able to measure how long it takes for such acid to melt a person.
[**.**.****] News about my success at creating replacement organs is starting to spread throughout the facility, finally stopping those nasty rumors about my work. I even got a request from one of my old colleagues to make a replacement organ for their faulty liver. To be honest, they should just drink less.
[**.**.****] Today, I got permission to fully mutate a Subject. The process wasn't hard due to my experience. But the result was a bit not what I was expecting. The body size was drastically smaller, than the original Subject. Its intellectual capacity was that of some small animal. But it was obedient enough, so I decided to label such a mutation as Fingerspike.

Discussion:
A comparison of the restored files with our facility's database revealed potential temporal discrepancies between the two realities. This divergence in time could explain the differences in database dates and the greater depth of the facility's underground structure.
The previously observed underground nests appear to be ventilation exits for the facility's subterranean floors.
The flesh mass network seems to function as a sensory system, monitoring the movements of intruders within it controlled territory. Similar to how the human body feels some bugs running on it skin.
Several study notes were successfully recovered and transferred back to our facility.

Recommendations:
Study: Prioritize the recovery of additional data from the control panel to gain further insights into the nature of this reality and the events that transpired here.
Technology Acquisition: Studying restored study notes could unlock new research projects.

li.label: #2/3 Terminal study report
li.text:
Breakthrough in Research

Abstract:
A research team delved into the depths of a flesh-infested facility, uncovering disturbing experiments conducted by a rogue scientist. The facility served as a hub for fleshmass research, with experiments ranging from organ mutation to mind control of fleshbeasts. The recovered data offers valuable insights into the potential applications and dangers of flesh mass technology.

Diary #3:
Researcher [REDACTED]
[**.**.****] I found a solution to the problem. I can incubate a fleshmass tumor from a cyst in a Subject, allowing for the mutation of new organs with even stronger effects. Pity that I need to request a new Subject for it each time, though.
[**.**.****] Today I was able to connect the brain tissue of a new Subject to a Fingerspike, allowing them to command it. To my surprise, it almost went out of control, when Subject was able to control unrelated Fingerspikes locked in a different room. This phenomenon requires more testing.
[**.**.****] I tried to combine multiple Fingerspikes into one, and the result went beyond my expectations. The resulting creature was able to execute commands, that normal Fingerspikes didn't even understand.

Diary #5:
Researcher [REDACTED]
[**.**.****] They forbid me from mutating myself. They afraid I'll loose my brilliant mind. But they're wrong! It will only help me understand the fleshmass better. They will understand, once I'm done.
[**.**.****] This pain! Why so much pain? But I can't stop here and now.
[**.**.****] This pain... is not my pain... The tumors still hold some of the person's mind within them. Their anger. It's not my pain! I need more, so I can control them!
[**.**.****] Finally, it's under my control. Their feelings are no longer in control. Now I can feel every single fleshbeast in the facility and command them. But I shouldn't tell them yet. They're still not ready to accept it.

Discussion:
The underground facility appears to have been a major hub for fleshmass research and experimentation.
The extensive network of underground structures suggests a significant investment in this field.
However, the facility has become compromised by the very substance it sought to study.
Several study notes were successfully recovered and transferred back to our facility.

Recommendations:
Study: Prioritize the recovery of additional data from the terminal to gain a comprehensive understanding of the facility's last moments.
Technology Acquisition: Studying restored study notes could unlock new research projects.

li.AnomalyDesc: A damaged computer terminal of this facility. It can be studied to download information from it database.\n\nCan be interacted to initiate immediate reactor meltdown of this facility. All unnecesary personnel should leave through Blood Lake Exit in advance of activation.
li.label: #3/3 Terminal study report
li.text:
Containment Breach

Abstract:
A team of researchers ventured into a flesh-infested facility, uncovering a disturbing experiment in human augmentation and flesh mass control. The facility's rogue scientist had developed the ability to manipulate and merge with the flesh mass, posing a significant threat to the facility and potentially the entire planet. The team must neutralize the threat by initiating a reactor meltdown, a desperate measure that will require sacrifice.

Diary #19:
Researcher [REDACTED]
[**.**.****] Now I'm in full control of my body. They were so afraid of my progress towards a new step in human evolution. I will help them become something new. Then they will understand.

System Recording of Containment Breach #*****:
[**:**] Fleshmass beasts have left containment and are gathering at the Lab of [REDACTED].
[**:**] Fleshmass beasts are starting to merge into a single organism-like structure. [REDACTED] was consumed by one of its walls.
[**:**] Containment measures on the Lab floor have failed.
[**:**] Containment measures on floors *** to *** have failed.
[**:**] Preparing for reactor meltdown by the command of Chief Researcher [REDACTED].
[**:**] Please input the command password...
[**:**] Please input the command password...
[**:**] Containment measures in the Reactor room have failed.

Observations:
A partially completed password input was discovered on the terminal.
Upon consulting with our Chief Researcher [REDACTED], the correct password was obtained.
Password was successfully accepted.
The terminal revealed a disabled automatic meltdown system, due to obstruction in the reactor room, requiring manual activation.

Discussion:
The unlocked manual override function presents an opportunity to vaporize the facility and the surrounding area, potentially containing the flesh mass infestation. However, this requires a sacrifice, as someone must remain behind to initiate and control the process. A priority should be given to evacuating personnel through the Blood Lake exit before activation.
Several study notes were successfully recovered and transferred back to our facility.

[High Level Access Required]:
A review of the recovered study notes suggests a more dire situation. The flesh mass may have already spread across the planet, making local containment efforts futile. We was lucky to find out about such scenario on other's mistakes. There is a high chance that eventually Fleshmass will find it way through Blood Lake to our reality. This elevate the threat level to higher than even Class-4, potentially causing our planet being consumed as well.
Destruction of this area will just clear local fleshmass, which will be infested after some time again, due to the planet scale infestation.

Recommendations:
Sacrificial Mission: A volunteer should be selected to initiate the manual meltdown, ensuring the containment of the flesh mass within this reality.
Technology Acquisition: Studying restored study notes could unlock new research projects.

li.activateDescString: Input the password into this terminal, which will initiate reactor meltdown deep underground. Explosion will reduce to atoms everything in this sector. Evacuation is required in advance. [Will destroy this map instantly after activation]

ThingDef.label: christmas tree
ThingDef.description: Giant fresh Christmas tree with some Christmas toys on it and some snow on it.\n\nClassified as Class-0 (Safe) anomaly.

li.AnomalyDesc:
Giant fresh Christmas tree with some Christmas toys on it and some snow on it.

Its needles emit frigid air, causing the surrounding temperature to plummet to -20 degrees. A hidden passage located behind the tree branches.

Classified as Class-1 (Caution) anomaly.
li.label: #2/4 Christmas tree study report
li.text:
Emiting Frigid Air

Subject: {PAWN_nameDef}

Abstract:
This report documents an anomalous tree emitting frigid air, causing a significant temperature drop within the containment room. The discovery of a hidden passage emanating from the tree necessitates a reclassification to Class-1 (Caution). Further research, including a manned expedition through the passage, is recommended.

Observations:
Sensors within the containment room detected a rapid decrease in temperature.
{PAWN_nameDef} was instructed to analyze the snow present on the tree and to install sensors to select branches.
A hidden passage was subsequently discovered behind the tree's branches.

Outcome:
Sensor readings confirmed that the tree's needles were emitting frigid air, registering temperatures as low as -20 degrees Celsius.

Discussion:
The emission of frigid air from the tree's needles likely accounts for the persistent presence of snow on the tree, even under high temperatures outside.
The presence of a hidden passage emanating from the tree suggests the existence of an unexplored location beyond it.
The potential size of this location may exceed the tree's physical dimensions, exhibiting spatial anomalies similar to those previously observed in the stockings.
Given the potential risk of hypothermia, the tree has been reclassified as Class-1 (Caution) anomaly.

Recommendations:
Study: Continued research on the tree's anomalous properties is crucial.
Expedition: A manned expedition should be organized to investigate the location accessible through the hidden passage.
Controlled Use: The tree's capacity to generate frigid air should be explored for potential applications as a controlled cooling source.

li.AnomalyDesc: Giant fresh Christmas tree with some Christmas toys on it and some snow on it.\n\nClassified as Class-0 (Safe) anomaly.
li.label: #1/4 Christmas tree study report
li.text:
Giant Tree

Subject: [REDACTED]

Abstract:
This report documents the anomalous extraction of a large tree from within a seemingly conventional Christmas stockings. The extraction process resulted in the destruction of the stockings. The retrieved tree exhibited rapid and anomalous root growth despite relocation attempts. Given the absence of hostile behavior, the tree has been classified as Class-0 (Safe) and is now the primary focus of ongoing anomalous research.

Observations:
To retrieve the final gift, a winch was employed to pull it from within the stockings.
The extraction process was time-consuming, but a portion of the gift eventually became visible.
The visible portion revealed a whole tree, significantly larger, than the containing it stockings.
Subject was instructed to continue the extraction operation.
With the application of additional force, the tree was successfully extracted, resulting in the complete destruction of the stockings.

Outcome:
The stockings were torn apart, losing all observed anomalous properties.
The retrieved tree exceeded both the dimensions of the stockings and the size of most trees within the facility territory.
Throughout the extraction and subsequent examination, the tree displayed no hostile behavior.

Discussion:
The stockings appear to have lacked sufficient elasticity to accommodate the size of the contained object. As a result, the fabric ruptured, expelling the object within. Analysis of the remaining fabric fragments revealed no anomalous properties.
Surface analysis indicated a design resembling a Christmas tree decorated with toys and snow. Despite relocation attempts, the tree consistently demonstrates rapid and anomalous root growth into the ground.
The retrieved tree has become the primary focus of this anomalous research.
Given the absence of hostile behavior, the tree has been temporary classified as Class-0 (Safe) anomaly.

Recommendations:
Continued research on the retrieved tree is necessary to further investigate its anomalous properties and explore potential applications.

li.AnomalyDesc:
Giant fresh Christmas tree with some Christmas toys on it and some snow on it.

Its needles emit frigid air, causing the surrounding temperature to plummet to -20 degrees. A hidden passage located behind the tree branches leading to the gifts.

Classified as Class-1 (Caution) anomaly.
li.label: #3/4 Christmas tree study report
li.text:
Celebration on the Other Side

Abstract:
This report documents the successful exploration of a passage located under the tree. The passage led to an expansive ice plain, where multiple boxes and animated snowmen were observed. The low ambient temperature presents a significant risk of the passage becoming impassable. Recommendations include the examination of the boxes, retrieval of valuable items, and the establishment of a defensive perimeter due to the potential for hostile encounters.

Observations:
An exploration team, consisting of [REDACTED], entered a passage located under the tree.
Following a brief period of travel through a dark, wooden-walled tunnel, the team reached an ice field.
The exit tree closely resembled the entry tree.
Multiple boxes of varying colors were observed in the vicinity of the tree exit, along with the presence of numerous snowmen.
Some team members reported observing movement among the snowmen.

Outcome:
The exploration team successfully traversed the passage under the tree and reached the destination.
Sensor data indicates that the ice plain is largely devoid of significant features, with the exception of a small area surrounding the tree exit.

Discussion:
The desolate nature of the ice plain suggests limited exploration potential beyond the immediate vicinity of the tree exit.
The low ambient temperature presents a significant concern, with a high probability of the passage becoming impassable due to freezing within few days. All operations within this area should therefore be conducted with urgency.

Recommendations:
Collection: The contents of the boxes should be examined, and any valuable items should be retrieved.
Security: The establishment of a defensive perimeter around the tree exit is crucial, with preparations for potential hostile encounters.

li.AnomalyLabel: The Cold Invitation to a Celebration
li.AnomalyDesc:
Giant fresh Christmas tree with some Christmas toys on it and some snow on it.

Its needles emit frigid air, causing the surrounding temperature to plummet to -20 degrees. Concealed within the tree's branches lies a passage leading to gifts protected by a snowman. The passage can be reopened again after arrival of the new year.

Classified as Class-1 (Caution) anomaly.
li.label: #4/4 Christmas tree study report
li.text:
Theory Regarding Christmas Tree

Subject: [REDACTED]

Abstract:
This report documents the temporary obstruction of a passage beneath tree due to ice and encroaching branches. Analysis suggests the passage may become accessible around the next new year date. The tree's classification remains Class-1 (Caution). A hypothesis suggests the tree facilitates annual access to a celebration, with participants undergoing a trial before receiving gifts. Continued visits to this location during future celebration period is recommended.


Observations:
Sensor data indicated that the passage under the tree had become obstructed by ice and encroaching branches.
Attempts to remove the ice and branches were unsuccessful.

Outcome:
Analysis of the ice formation suggests a potential melting around the next new year date.

Discussion:
The passage under the tree currently appears impassable. However, based on ice analysis, a reopening of the passage may be feasible around the next new year date.
Given the collected data on this tree, its current classification as a Class-1 (Caution) anomaly remains unchanged.

Hypothesis:
[REDACTED] has proposed a theory suggesting that the stockings served as an invitation to a celebration. While the tree itself may function as a means of transportation to this celebration. Participants of this celebration may undergo a trial administered by the surrounding snowman guards. Successful completion of this trial grants access to gifts left for the participants. The purpose and motivations behind this generosity remain unknown. Since the celebration occurs annually, the means of transportation likely remains with the participants in deactivated state between celebration.

Recommendations:
Controlled Use: Continued visits to this location during future celebration periods are recommended to utilize the provided gifts for the benefit of this facility.

ThingDef.label: christmas tree exit
ThingDef.description: Giant fresh Christmas tree with some Christmas toys on it and some snow on it.\n\nThis is an exit on the other side from Christmas tree on a territory of our facility. Can be entered to return to our facility.

ThingDef.label: ancient server
ThingDef.description: An ancient server composed of three connected sections. The data it holds, however, remains unknown.

li.AnomalyDesc: This ancient server, featuring three interconnected sections and safeguarding an perception-based encrypted database. It seems to contain its own power source and resistant to outside damage. It is constantly engaged in processing, receiving and transmitting data to an unknown destination.\n\nClassified as Class-0 (Safe) anomaly.
li.label: #1/3 Ancient Database study report
li.text:
Encrypted Database

Subject: {PAWN_nameDef}

Abstract:
Initial examination of the recovered ancient server revealed an internal power source, negating the need for external connections. Standard input and output peripherals were successfully interfaced via a surface access port. However, the output displayed incomprehensible linguistic data, despite utilizing a known language. Physical attempts to breach the server's internal structure proved unsuccessful. Subsequent data analysis confirmed the presence of a database with currently indecipherable content, theorized to be protected by a perception-based encryption method.

Observations:
Upon initial examination, {PAWN_nameDef} noted that server seems to be self-powered without any outside source of power.
Subject was able to connect standard input and output device to server through access port on it surface.
{PAWN_nameDef} reported an inability to comprehend the textual output, despite its apparent composition in a language familiar to the Subject.
Attempts by {PAWN_nameDef} to forcibly access the server's internal components through physical manipulation yielded no discernible progress.

Outcome:
The ancient server did not exhibit any overt hostile behavior during the observation and manipulation process.
Comprehensive analysis of the data retrieved from the server confirmed the presence of a structured database, the specific contents of which remain presently undetermined.

Discussion:
Linguistic analysis confirmed that all data within database is using same language used within our facility. Nevertheless, surprisingly, none of the reviewing personnel could ascertain its meaning, experiencing a transient loss of comprehension upon attempting to read individual words, as if the moment they read each word it slips away from their mind. We theorize that this is some sort of perception-based encrypted method used by server to restrict data access from conventional users.
Was noticed that any user activity decrease operational efficiency of constant processing, receiving and transmitting data to currently unknown destination.
Given the lack of hostile behavior, database has been temporary classified as Class-0 (Safe) anomaly.

Recommendations:
Additional study and analysis of database content is require to gain further understanding.

li.AnomalyDesc:
This ancient server, featuring three interconnected sections and safeguarding an perception-based encrypted entity database. It seems to contain its own power source and resistant to outside damage. It is constantly engaged in processing, receiving and transmitting data to the void.

Can be connected with through psychic ritual to provoke selected entity in database.

Classified as Class-2 (Warning) anomaly.
li.label: #2/3 Ancient Database study report
li.text:
Found Data on Known Entities

Subject: {PAWN_nameDef}

Abstract:
During a standard database review, {PAWN_nameDef} identified several comprehensible entries. Analysis revealed these entries contain data pertaining to anomalous entities previously encountered in this facility. Furthermore, information regarding a ritual and the destination of the server's continuous data transmission was uncovered. This confirms the server's function as an entity database, with only familiar entities lacking perception-based encryption. The escalating risk of the server provoking hostile entity manifestations has prompted a reclassification to Class-2 (Warning). A potential Database Erasure Protocol has been located, but decryption requires further analysis. Controlled ritualistic connection for acquiring known entities, continued protocol decryption, and user interaction to suppress void provocation are recommended.

Observations:
During a routine inspection of the database, {PAWN_nameDef} reported the identification of a limited number of entries that were readily understandable.
Subsequent analysis of these accessible entries indicated that they contained data directly related to anomalous entities encountered in prior incidents.
Additionally, an entry detailing a specific ritual and information concerning the recipient of the server's ongoing data transmissions were discovered.

Outcome:
It has been definitively established that the server functions as an entity database. Notably, only data pertaining to entities with which we have prior experience is not subject to perception-based encryption.
Each entity entry also includes supplementary, currently unidentified information associated with a ritual process.

Discussion:
Our preliminary understanding suggests this ritual mechanism operates similarly to the void provocation ritual, involving the transmission of a specific psychic pulse containing entry data into the void. This action potentially facilitates the manifestation of the entity corresponding to the selected database entry.
We have also observed a consistent increase in the rate of data transmission into the void, a process that could lead to the spontaneous provocation of entities if not mitigated by user interaction.
The growing threat of entity database provoking void to summon hostile anomalies has led to the reclassification of it to Class-2 (Warning).
Evidence of a Database Erasure Protocol has been found, representing a potential method for neutralizing the server, although its decryption requires further dedicated effort.

Recommendations:
Controlled Use: It is recommended to to perfom Connect With Entity Database ritual to acquire new instances of previously found anomalous entities.
Study: Continued efforts towards the decryption of the Database Erasure Protocol are recommended to potentially unlock a last-resort neutralization option.
Suppression: Regular user interaction with the database is advised to slow down its process of provoking the void and potentially summoning entities.

li.label: #3/3 Ancient Database study report
li.text:
Database Erasure Protocol

Subject: {PAWN_nameDef}

Abstract:
The Database Erasure Protocol is decrypted and ready. Subject accessed server system data. A hypothesis was proposed by {PAWN_nameDef}.

Outcome:
The decryption process for the Database Erasure Protocol has been finished, and the protocol is now ready for immediate deployment. Furthermore, Subject successfully accessed specific segments of the server's underlying system data.

Hypothesis:
{PAWN_nameDef} has formulated a hypothesis concerning the nature of the Entity Database. This server appears to be a copy, supposedly engineered by employee [REDACTED] of our facility as a comprehensive repository of information pertaining to void creatures, based on the existing Entity Database from the year [REDACTED]. Which shouldn't be possible, since this year is so far away in the future. This raising the possibility that the employee has not yet been born, as no evidence of them exists at our time. This database not only stores data on anomalous entities but also incorporates mechanisms to provoke the void, thereby attracting such entities. The server was intentionally modified to establish a direct connection with the void to enhance its operational efficiency. However, a critical system anomaly occurring on [REDACTED] is theorized to have disabled crucial safety protocols limiting data transmission to the void, resulting in the facility being overwhelmed by various entities. Following this critical failure, a perception-based encryption mechanism was implemented as a safeguard to prevent the attraction of high-threat entities. This measure effectively restricted database utilization by unauthorized personnel, limiting access primarily to data concerning entities already familiar to the user. Additionally, the Database Erasure Protocol was integrated as a final contingency for the server's destruction should it fall into unauthorized hands. [REDACTED] appears to be the latest recorded date, possibly indicating when it was sent to our time.

Recommendations:
Neutralization: Activation of the Database Erasure Protocol presents a potentially optimal strategy for the complete destruction of this server, thereby mitigating the risk of future void provocation incidents.
Controlled Use: It is recommended to to perfom Connect With Entity Database ritual to acquire new instances of previously found anomalous entities.
Contingency Plan: This database could function as a backup of all the information we've collected about the anomalies we've come across.

li.label: Ancient Database summoning incident report
li.text:
Psychic Pulse

Abstract:
Server efficiency surged to 200%, followed by a psychic pulse and a [REDACTED] entity incident. Efficiency dropped to 50%. This highlights the server's void-provoking danger, requiring 4 days to regain peak efficiency. User interaction is recommended to suppress this process and prevent entity summoning.

Observations:
The server's operational efficiency peaked at 200%.
A distinct psychic pulse emanated from the server unit.
Within a short timeframe of several hours following the pulse, an incident involving the [REDACTED] entity took place.

Outcome:
The server's operational efficiency subsequently decreased to 50%.

Discussion:
This incident illustrates the inherent threat posed by the server's capacity to provoke the void and attract dangerous anomalous entities to our facility. The observed 4 day duration required for the server to return to a 200% operational efficiency level from 50% underscores the necessity of consistent user interaction with the database to counteract and reduce its operational efficiency, thereby mitigating the risk of further provocations.

Recommendations:
Suppression: Consistent user interaction with the database is strongly advised as a countermeasure to slow down its inherent process of provoking the void and, consequently, reducing the likelihood of summoning potentially hostile entities.
